comment: Condescending. Unavailable to questions. Class is not that hard, the material is easy, he is just a tough grader. The homeworks are required in report format, where each assignment is similar to an essay. It is not good enough to show the right answer, you must 'discuss' this answer and how it can be improved. Avoid, but mandatory for MSCS...

Reference: already have a 4yr degree, was my first C. If you email him with a problem, the response is about 15 words less, half of them patronizing. His online lectures are recorded from IRL lectures 5 years old. You can hear him insult students in the class in those recording. Hands out C's and D's like candy, never gives constructive criticism.
He goes by the textbook he wrote and grades strictly.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Rude and condescending, completely opaque grading criteria, absurdly vague and overcomplicating instructions on assignments and the project, and a complete unwillingness to give any useful feedback at all. Lectures are useless because he meanders on about random stuff barely related to the course material. Avoid, avoid, avoid.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I did not listen to the reviews. Please do not make the same mistake as me. This professor is the worst professor out of all my three years so far.

Prepare for computer science trivia in his class. He'll randomly call on you in class and ask you a random computer science question. If you get it, great. If not, I hope you can handle the humiliation. It's not fun.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This professor is inconsistent, apathetic, and unhelpful.  Avoid this man at all costs.  If you need help with something, he will email you to read the book or just say "up to you."  His grading is sporadic and inconsistent.  He has no clear guidelines to follow.  He wrote the textbook, but you can directly word from it and still get points off.

Dr. Garrido is a very interesting character. All of your assignments will need to be submitted in a report format and he does not use multiple choice questions. It was a bit tedious at first, however, I found that the class was did help me to approach problem solving a lot better and you definitely will learn by the end.
Literally the worst professor you can text please just get anyone else. I saw the warning and went ahead and I hate myself for it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Professor Garrido is an incredibly hard to please teacher. For starters he wrote the textbook for the class, however even then when still directly quoting from his own textbook he will still take points off with no explanation. Test and quiz averages are consistently below 70, and on top of that he NEVER gives a 100%, even if you earned it.

He's honestly not too bad, and if you stick around to the end, you'll learn a lot if you put in the work. His exams are all short response, and he's picky about the language you use. The assignments can be confusing so start early. He's accessible to email but doesn't give any feedback on projects/quizzes/exams which is detrimental to learning IMO.
He doesn't give feedback for some reason. Remember his signature phase ¡Exprópiese! and you will do well

Garrido is quite tough. His style takes some getting used to. He's a little disorganized and vague, but makes sure you learn. I took this and 3502 with him. To do well, you need to understand and explain the material. Read the textbook and slides. Assignments are heavily writing-based, and quizzes and tests are all written response. It's... doable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: he is one of the worst people not just as a professor but as a man too; he would hold you responsible for anything stupid and small; one of things happened and I had complain him to the department was about weekly quiz ; every professor would have a quiz online to take whenever you want but him opens the quiz for one day and two hours only.

Gr. Garrido is by far the most unprofessional and sadistic man employed by the university system of Georgia. I took him for concepts of programming languages. During one of his first lectures he stated that his job was to confuse us students. He gives you a vague semester long project and refuses to give any help. Run as far away him as possible...

Very knowledgable on theory. Little/no feedback. Grades based on how well you match his answer/definition and page format. Broken links on project info. Backup video locked in prior module. Unhelpful unless you go to virtual office hours. Marked off on a question he wrote incorrectly. Gives 100s on assignments at the end to curve. Doable but avoid.

Garrido means well. He's tough to get behind at the beginning of the semester, but he becomes a more lenient if you stick around to the end of the course. He's a picky grader, so use precise and formal language, but if you pay attention to how he answers his own questions and take note of the questions he asks but doesn't answer, you'll be alright.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Tough & Inconsistent grader. Gives little to no feedback. Requires everything from d2l text box answers to homework assignments that are on average 10pg. reports be formatted how he likes. And how he likes is unclear and when you dont submit with proper format he hurts your grade significantly instead of focusing on content. Horrible experience.

Oh lord where do I begin. Quizzes are done online, but in class. He took points off one of my quizzes cuz I didn't have a laptop to bring to class. He will only give feedback on the first quiz and that "feedback" is useless. Vague quiz/test questions and lectures that ultimately don't matter since you have to teach yourself the material
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Horrible professor. Will take off like A LOT of points for things that are not specified ANYWHERE. He locks all modules after they are over so there is no way of going back to review. Takes off even more points for giving an answer that is near identical to the one he puts in his quiz solutions after quiz is over. He doesnt care about your grade.

For a professor with literal nearly impossible standards, he cannot manage to communicate with his students on any sort of reasonable level. Material isn't presented properly, and announcements on assignment changes are last minute and sometimes deleted shortly after. He fails to deliver as a professor, and will then punish you for it. Avoid.
AVOID. No redeemable qualities. Take at your own risk.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Yikes. Recommend that you avoid this one. Very smart guy, but not the best communicator. Say it with me, "If you're looking for that 4.0, you may want to pass on Garrido."
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Garrido's online class is horribly organized, and he doesn't leave feedback. His communication is also as bare-bones as possible. He was very hands off with my class, and every single test average was posted for us to see - all of them failing averages. His grading criteria is incredibly vague, and his grading style is actually malicious.

Dr. Garrido is a very unique character. My second favorite professor @ KSU. Dr. Garrido is the most challenging professor I've ever encountered. His tests aren't difficult, it's his grading technique that makes it difficult. But if one understood why, they wouldn't cry: If you can't articulate something, then you don't understand the material.
hate this class.. please avoid
hardest class i have ever taken. Tough grader. I would definetly avoid.
I drop this class because he is just horrible, as other coments says he cannot grade right. Thinks we are on his level
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: This teacher has a very poor planning for his class. You cant tell when he is joking and then transitions to class topic. He gives long answers Quiz and grades his tests in a very meticulous manner. Not a very standard way of instruction that we are used to with other professors.

He is more into definitions, he just want you to write what ever he has in his mind on exam. Very vague long questions. I do not recommend you to take this class if this is ur only chance. He is just impossible.
This guy dont know how to grade anything. If this guy is ur only choise then wait till next semester to take it. He will fail you. Dont know how to grade anything.
Very very strict assignments. All assignments and projects must be submitted in his style report. Impossible to get 100s and always has something about what you said that he doesnt like. Use book!

Garrido is an interesting character. One of the best CS professors at KSU. His exams are on the tougher end, most are short answer and he is very specific in the vocabulary he wants, you must learn the material. Most of his course content consists of programs written by him. His courses can be vague and spotty at times but is very lenient.

Good ol' Garrido. If you want to learn then you take him. OS isn't the most interesting class but he does make it easy to understand and a little more enjoyable. There are lots of quizzes and homework - which are reports. Basically, everything is free response and he's quite specific on what he wants. Though, you won't fail if you struggle.

This dude is BRUTAL. His classes are boring and rarely stay on topic. If you aren't at class 5 minutes early, be ready to answer a random and ridiculous question on the spot. His grading style is iffy at best and is not helpful with assignments as he barely knows how to do them. Class is disorganized. Would NOT recommend and would NOT take again.

This teacher has a very poor planning for his class. You cant tell when he is joking and then transitions to class topic. He gives long answers Quiz and grades his tests in a very meticulous manner.  Not a very standard way of instruction that we are used to with other professors.

Learning about Operating Systems was a bore but Garrido is a good guy. There are weekly quizzes that are essay format and you have to be really precise or he'll take off points. I bombed the midterm but he provides a lot of extra credit assignments which gave me a B in the class. Nobody fails the course but you will fail some quizzes.
Nice guy, very funny. He won't spoon feed you answers so you'll need to do some research on your own time, but I'd say it was worth it. I would take him again.

Tests are essay format & long. He seems to only grade based on how well he is feeling that day, not by looking at your answers. If you ask him to explain his grading, he will just mumble and give excuses. If you know how to teach yourself, you will be fine, otherwise don't expect to learn much from him.

Professor Garrido is a very smart man, and it reflects in the class. He expects a lot from his students, especially if they want an A.  The book is a necessity, for most quizzes and tests will be drawn from it.  It can be hard to pay attention at times because of his accent/the material, but if you wish to do well, put the effort in.  Great teacher
He doesn't seem to understand that college freshmen are not on his level. He's a genius, but he can't teach.

I will have 39 credit hrs at the end of this semester all A's except for this class which is looking like a C.  He is awful, the book is awful. It may be just me but I know most of the students think he is a bad teacher.  If you already know programming, take him. He just doesn't provide any actual learning. grading scale is easy, tests are hard.

Terrible teacher. Avoid at all costs. He expects you to know everything prior to entering the class, and I took the class looking to learn some programming. I literally didn't learn anything. Never used the textbook. Weekly quizzes, and assignments that he doesn't explain how to do. Always goes off on tangents about unrelated topics.

He grades you on your handwriting and doesnt really help with questions due to his thick "southern" accent.  His favorite pie is apple and the only way you can get an okay grade is by kissing up to him.

BAD TEACHER. Dont take his class. No matter how hard you work or how much you study, your answers are going to be wrong. Every time i'm right, im wrong in his book.  My test average is about 50/100 and that is good for this class.

The material is boring but he's laid back and tells a lot of corny jokes. The simulation assignments were confusing but easy and he doesn't deduct points for turning them in late. Tests and quizzes are 100% essay and tough. He expects you to use technical language in your answer. The class is a lot of work but almost nobody makes less than a C.

He's a great guy, but this class is worthless. We take tests but never go over the results. We never get to find out WHY our answers were wrong. What we see on the tests does NOT match the level of the material we cover in class. We cover too much material too fast and the class average is usually below 50. This is not learning.

Hilarious guy, and he explains the majority of his lessons well (occasionally goes off on tangents or uses unorthodox terminology). Unfortunately, his tests seem to ask questions at a higher level than what he goes over in class. I was not the best student, but the class averaged a 29 on the first test. Uses a curve on test, but be prepared anyway.

Simulation and Object Oriented Design. I've had Garrido for OS and Data Stru. & Algo. As always, I learn a lot from his classes. This class is offered only every now and then from my understanding, and is pretty useful. The only qualm I had with this class was using his simulation language which really just translates into Java. Highly recommended.

He is an excellent professor with a good sense of humor. He is very approachable and easy to talk to.  He does speak English with an accent, but it is not difficult to understand him.  He is hard, but we're here to learn.  I definitely respect his knowledge in Computer Science.
fun class.

You can't go wrong with Garrido, tries as much as possible to make class fun, has a great sense of humor & hands out extra credit tests like candy. Jst show up & put in a little effort & you'll definitely make it.

I knew alot about this subject before getting into the class, he was a bit tough, and his accent didn't make it very easy for some people, but beyond that he was absolutly hillarious.  I thoroughly enjoyed his class
Very nice professor and very willing to help.  But, he is a little hard to follow.  Found his grading more than fair.
Very nice man, very helpful, does have a tendency to talk a little over student's head
Notice all the people that don't like him also cannot spell.  He is intelligent and mixes humor in his lectures.  Stop whining just because not all classes have been dumbed down for you.
Absolutely HORRIBLE not clear can not teach the point s and grading is unclear
Man this guy is the worst yet. He might be smart but he can't teach.
very nice professor.. he is a geneous.
Sucks for and advisor. Makes you pay for $100 book to due HW
